dismissalText.long: hit wicket b Mustafizur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Imam-ul-Haq hit wicket b Mustafizur Rahman 100 (100b 7x4 0x6 172m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: is he hit wicket? The bails are off, but Imam isn't certain he's knocked it off. Was it the wind? Replays suggest nope - Imam's back leg, while trying to flick off his back foot, has broken the stumps. What an end to the innings! Walks back disappointed, but raises his bat for the crowd

headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Saifuddin  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: lbw b Mohammad Saifuddin
dismissalText.commentary: Babar Azam lbw b Mohammad Saifuddin 96 (98b 11x4 0x6 102m) SR: 97.95

dismissalComment.html: yorker gets him on the toes on leg stump! Given and he's reviewed it immediately! Only doubt is whether this is sliding down leg. He was hit quite full and the review is showing three reds. He was struck in line with middle and leg shuffling across deep in the crease. Don't think he realized how far across he went. Very poor review. Seemed to be more that he did it because he was four away from a century more than because he thought it would be overturned.

dismissalComment.html: taken at deep extra cover! Back of a length, just outside off, and cut uppishly. In the air for ages, and the man in the deep won't make any mistake. 100th ODI wicket for the Fizz

headshotImage.caption: Shadab Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shadab Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: catch of the tournament? Full, on middle, and the leg-side clip takes a leading edge. Ball pops back straight, and Mustafizur dives diagonally forward with his left hand stretched out, and manages to take a claw-like catch just centimetres from the ground

dismissalComment.html: sliced and taken by third man! Slower ball, back of a length outside off, and Imad was through his shot too early

dismissalComment.html: another five-for! Back of a length, just outside off, and the attempted cut goes straight to the keeper. Thin edge this time. Joins Imam on the Lord's honours board

dismissalText.long: c Sarfaraz Ahmed b Shaheen Shah Afridi
dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c Sarfaraz Ahmed b Shaheen Shah Afridi 64 (77b 6x4 0x6 109m) SR: 83.11

dismissalComment.html: edged and taken! And Shakib Al Hasan's glorious World Cup campaign comes to an end. Tried to cut this square, but beaten by the extra pace, and he leaves to a huge roar from the Bangladesh fans. Seven half-centuries can you believe it. Take a bow, Shakib. Take a bow. Ending the campaign with 606 runs - the third most in a single men's World Cup edition (Both Sachin and Hayden played double-digit games though)

dismissalText.long: c Haris Sohail b Shaheen Shah Afridi
dismissalText.commentary: Litton Das c Haris Sohail b Shaheen Shah Afridi 32 (40b 3x4 0x6 38m) SR: 80

dismissalComment.html: and strikes immediately with a cross-seam off-speed delivery! Pitched on a full length on fifth stump, Liton was out in front of this drive and struggled badly to keep his hands back. It results in a checked drive as the ball floats in the air softly toward Haris at cover. He shuffles 5 yards left and takes a basic catch at waist height.

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Saifuddin  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Saifuddin  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: caught mid-off, Shaheen has four! Flat batted a length ball at 135 kph outside off stump, a firm drive but no elevation and Amir five yards inside the ring takes a good catch crouching to his left at knee height.

headshotImage.caption: Mahmudullah headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Mahmudullah headshot

dismissalComment.html: five-for with a yorker! Reverse swing at 142 kph sears into middle and leg stump beating Mahmudullah's vain stab. Youngest bowler to claim a five-wicket haul in a World Cup. And he doesn't look done yet! He's got 15 deliveries to get to 7 in the match.

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: bouncer-yorker combo produces the best ever figures by a Pakistan bowler in a World Cup! Majority of the people in the ground and at home had to know it was coming. Mustafizur had to know it was coming. But this is just too good tailing into leg stump and Mustafizur is helpless trying to stab it out while backing away. What a show put on by the teenager!

headshotImage.longCaption: Shadab Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: full, on middle, and he lofts it inside-out. But no distance behind that shot, and Babar comfortably pouches a catch

headshotImage.caption: Mashrafe Mortaza headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Mashrafe Mortaza headshot

dismissalComment.html: clever by Shadab! Mashrafe had gotten into the habit of charging and this time telegraphed it too early. Shadab responded by dragging this back shorter and wider well outside off. Mashrafe not remotely close to the pitch trying to cut it as the ball comes to Sarfaraz just inside the wide guidelines outside off and he shuffles back to the stumps to take the bails off with Mashrafe's back foot a half meter short of getting back in.

dismissalText.commentary: Soumya Sarkar c Fakhar Zaman b Mohammad Amir 22 (22b 4x4 0x6 20m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: sharp catch at point by Fakhar! Short ball on fifth stump, enough width to have a go but Soumya can't get over the top of this. Cracks the ball flat in the air toward Fakhar at cover point who tumbles right and takes this at about ankle height, 7/10 on degree of difficulty coming at a low height at pace.

dismissalComment.html: edged and taken! And Shakib Al Hasan's glorious World Cup campaign comes to an end. Tried to cut this square, but beaten by the extra pace, and he leaves to a huge roar from the Bangladesh fans. Seven half-centuries can you believe it. Take a bow, Shakib. Take a bow. Ending the campaign with 606 runs - the third most in a single men's World Cup edition (Both Sachin and Hayden played double-digit games though)

commentPreTextItems.html: WATCH - Shaheen becomes youngest-ever to claim five-for in World Cup (Australia, UK and SEA only)

commentTextItems.html: bouncer-yorker combo produces the best ever figures by a Pakistan bowler in a World Cup! Majority of the people in the ground and at home had to know it was coming. Mustafizur had to know it was coming. But this is just too good tailing into leg stump and Mustafizur is helpless trying to stab it out while backing away. What a show put on by the teenager!

commentPostTextItems.html: 6.25pm And that's a wrap from us at ESPNcricinfo. Pakistan fans, farewell. Bangladesh fans, goodbye. Time for you guys to switch into neutrals tomorrow - and we'll see you soon with more World Cup action. Till then, it's goodbye from me, Sreshth, on behalf of Peter Della Penna and Ranjith P.

Sarfaraz Ahmed: "It's very unfortunate - we played good cricket but haven't qualified. That one game, against West Indies, cost us the tournament. Boys responded well after the India game. Did well in all three after that - batting, bowling, fielding. When we started the World Cup, we had a different combination. We need to sit down. We have two months off, and we need to do a lot of work with the team. At the moment, when team is winning everything is fine. Credit to our batsmen - Imam, Babar and Haris. And the bowlers - Amir, Shadab, Wahab, Shaheen. The way Shaheen is bowling, the consistency is amazing. One of the best bowling performances I've ever seen."

Mashrafe Mortaza: "I think both matches - last two matches - Shakib batted so well but we couldn't get partnerships. Game was 50-50, think we could've chased it, but partnerships were missing. I want to say sorry for Shakib, if we stepped up the tournament could've been different. Batted, bowled, fielded well - he was fantastic. Some important matches, our fielding wasn't good. It cost us a lot. Batting was fantastic. Mustafizur, starting from his career, he was unplayable. He got injured, but since our Ireland tour he's been really good. Hopefully no injuries for him in the future. Real asset for Bangladesh cricket. We are not satisfied. Could've finished the World Cup on a good note, but end of the day, we've had a 50-50 World Cup. You give your 100%, and sometimes you need a bit of luck - but it's never been with us. I will go home and rethink of my career, and then make a final call. Thanks to all supporters - present all over the ground and back home. They keep supporting us. Hopefully next time we will make them happy."
Mariam: "So close yet so far. Still proud of my team."

M.: "As heartbroken I am about Pakistan's spot in the semis, we did perform really well. Had it not been for those little moments that went against us, the semi spot was ours. Losing to Australia from an upper position, Braithwaite caught at the boundary, SL game washed out, NZ losing the toss to England and forced to field and other little moments. "

Ruksan Fayaz: "Pakistan's team selection in first few matches were not perfect. Pak gave preference to age and experience instead of talent and energy. Age and experience matter in politics not cricket."
Jawad: "Pakistan goes down fighting. Well done Pakistan."

Here's the Player of the Match, Shaheen Shah Afridi: "I'm happy for this performance. It's a special feeling for me, my family, for all of Pakistan. The wicket was slow. The first innings Mustafizur bowled well using cutters and I thought I would use cutters."
Aman: "If only Braithwaite could have hit that 6 .. If only Shaheen was part of Pak playing 11 from the start ..Pak would have been in SF"

Murali Krishnan: "Yesterday was a teenager with the bat creating a record. Today is another teenager with the ball, creating a record. Can we have a hatrick tomorrow? Any teenager playing in the two matches? "

6.06 pm Shaheen's celebratory march off is pre-empted as the Pakistan squad create a mini-guard of honor for Shoaib Malik. He's not in the XI today but they wanted to give him whatever dignified farewell may be possible at his last World Cup for the 37-year-old ex-captain.

He was hit quite full and the review is showing three reds. He was struck in line with middle and leg shuffling across deep in the crease. Don't think he realized how far across he went. Very poor review. Seemed to be more that he did it because he was four away from a century more than because he thought it would be overturned.

headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Saifuddin  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: lbw b Mohammad Saifuddin
dismissalText.commentary: Babar Azam lbw b Mohammad Saifuddin 96 (98b 11x4 0x6 102m) SR: 97.95

dismissalComment.html: yorker gets him on the toes on leg stump! Given and he's reviewed it immediately! Only doubt is whether this is sliding down leg. He was hit quite full and the review is showing three reds. He was struck in line with middle and leg shuffling across deep in the crease. Don't think he realized how far across he went. Very poor review. Seemed to be more that he did it because he was four away from a century more than because he thought it would be overturned.

dismissalComment.html: is he hit wicket? The bails are off, but Imam isn't certain he's knocked it off. Was it the wind? Replays suggest nope - Imam's back leg, while trying to flick off his back foot, has broken the stumps. What an end to the innings! Walks back disappointed, but raises his bat for the crowd

dismissalText.long: c Sarfaraz Ahmed b Shaheen Shah Afridi
dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c Sarfaraz Ahmed b Shaheen Shah Afridi 64 (77b 6x4 0x6 109m) SR: 83.11

dismissalComment.html: edged and taken! And Shakib Al Hasan's glorious World Cup campaign comes to an end. Tried to cut this square, but beaten by the extra pace, and he leaves to a huge roar from the Bangladesh fans. Seven half-centuries can you believe it. Take a bow, Shakib. Take a bow. Ending the campaign with 606 runs - the third most in a single men's World Cup edition (Both Sachin and Hayden played double-digit games though)

dismissalComment.html: and strikes immediately with a cross-seam off-speed delivery! Pitched on a full length on fifth stump, Liton was out in front of this drive and struggled badly to keep his hands back. It results in a checked drive as the ball floats in the air softly toward Haris at cover. He shuffles 5 yards left and takes a basic catch at waist height.

dismissalText.long: st Sarfaraz Ahmed b Shadab Khan
dismissalText.commentary: Mashrafe Mortaza st Sarfaraz Ahmed b Shadab Khan 15 (14b 0x4 2x6 14m) SR: 107.14

dismissalComment.html: clever by Shadab! Mashrafe had gotten into the habit of charging and this time telegraphed it too early. Shadab responded by dragging this back shorter and wider well outside off. Mashrafe not remotely close to the pitch trying to cut it as the ball comes to Sarfaraz just inside the wide guidelines outside off and he shuffles back to the stumps to take the bails off with Mashrafe's back foot a half meter short of getting back in.

dismissalComment.html: bouncer-yorker combo produces the best ever figures by a Pakistan bowler in a World Cup! Majority of the people in the ground and at home had to know it was coming. Mustafizur had to know it was coming. But this is just too good tailing into leg stump and Mustafizur is helpless trying to stab it out while backing away. What a show put on by the teenager!

dismissalComment.html: sharp catch at point by Fakhar! Short ball on fifth stump, enough width to have a go but Soumya can't get over the top of this. Cracks the ball flat in the air toward Fakhar at cover point who tumbles right and takes this at about ankle height, 7/10 on degree of difficulty coming at a low height at pace.

dismissalText.long: c Haris Sohail b Shaheen Shah Afridi
dismissalText.commentary: Litton Das c Haris Sohail b Shaheen Shah Afridi 32 (40b 3x4 0x6 38m) SR: 80

dismissalComment.html: and strikes immediately with a cross-seam off-speed delivery! Pitched on a full length on fifth stump, Liton was out in front of this drive and struggled badly to keep his hands back. It results in a checked drive as the ball floats in the air softly toward Haris at cover. He shuffles 5 yards left and takes a basic catch at waist height.

dismissalText.long: c Sarfaraz Ahmed b Shaheen Shah Afridi
dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c Sarfaraz Ahmed b Shaheen Shah Afridi 64 (77b 6x4 0x6 109m) SR: 83.11

dismissalComment.html: edged and taken! And Shakib Al Hasan's glorious World Cup campaign comes to an end. Tried to cut this square, but beaten by the extra pace, and he leaves to a huge roar from the Bangladesh fans. Seven half-centuries can you believe it. Take a bow, Shakib. Take a bow. Ending the campaign with 606 runs - the third most in a single men's World Cup edition (Both Sachin and Hayden played double-digit games though)

dismissalText.long: b Shaheen Shah Afridi
dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah b Shaheen Shah Afridi 29 (41b 3x4 0x6 64m) SR: 70.73

dismissalComment.html: five-for with a yorker! Reverse swing at 142 kph sears into middle and leg stump beating Mahmudullah's vain stab. Youngest bowler to claim a five-wicket haul in a World Cup. And he doesn't look done yet! He's got 15 deliveries to get to 7 in the match.

dismissalText.long: st Sarfaraz Ahmed b Shadab Khan
dismissalText.commentary: Mashrafe Mortaza st Sarfaraz Ahmed b Shadab Khan 15 (14b 0x4 2x6 14m) SR: 107.14

dismissalComment.html: clever by Shadab! Mashrafe had gotten into the habit of charging and this time telegraphed it too early. Shadab responded by dragging this back shorter and wider well outside off. Mashrafe not remotely close to the pitch trying to cut it as the ball comes to Sarfaraz just inside the wide guidelines outside off and he shuffles back to the stumps to take the bails off with Mashrafe's back foot a half meter short of getting back in.

dismissalText.long: b Shaheen Shah Afridi
dismissalText.commentary: Mustafizur Rahman b Shaheen Shah Afridi 1 (3b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: bouncer-yorker combo produces the best ever figures by a Pakistan bowler in a World Cup! Majority of the people in the ground and at home had to know it was coming. Mustafizur had to know it was coming. But this is just too good tailing into leg stump and Mustafizur is helpless trying to stab it out while backing away. What a show put on by the teenager!

seriesStandings.notes:
League Stage
In the event of teams finishing on equal points
* The team with the most wins in the League Stage will be placed in the higher position.
* If there are teams with equal points and equal wins in the League Stage then in such case the teams will be ordered according to their net run rate in the League Stage matches.
* If there are teams that are still equal, they will be ordered according to the result(s) of the head to head match(es) played between them (points, then if still equal, net run rate in those matches).
* If the above does not resolve the League Stage ordering and there are teams that are still equal, the teams will be ordered as per their League Stage seedings.
* If all matches in the League Stage produce no results the teams will be ordered as per their League Stage seedings and the top 4 seeded teams will progress to Semi-Finals.
Semi Final
If a Semi-Final is tied, the teams shall compete in a Super Over to determine which team progresses to the Final.
If following a tie, weather conditions prevent the Super Over from being completed, or if the match is abandoned or a no result at the end of the reserve day, then the team which proceeds to the Final will be the team that finished in the higher position in the League Stage.
Final
In the event of a tied final, the teams shall compete in a Super Over to determine which team is the winner.
If following a tie, weather conditions prevent the Super Over from being completed, or if the match is abandoned or a no result at the end of the reserve day, the teams shall be declared joint winners.

video.summary: Misbah-ul-Haq, who was critical of the left-arm quick earlier in the tournament, said that the teenager made the difference for Pakistan towards the end of the World Cup
